<JD_START>
Job Title: Senior Sales Account Executive - Enterprise

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
At Emburse our mission is to help make our users’ lives – and their businesses – better. We are dramatically transforming how organizations manage corporate expenses and invoices. We humanize work by automating manual tasks and saving users’ time, so they can focus on what matters most – their family, community, or more rewarding work. We help CFO’s give their employees a simple and amazing experience while ensuring compliance and reducing costs. Our solutions are tailored for companies from start-ups and SMBs to enterprises such as Microsoft, Pinterest, Bosch, Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, and Estee Lauder. We have more than 18,000 customers and 12 million users globally.

Senior Account Executives will focus on finding and closing deals with companies over 2500+ employees in size. "New Logo Sales"  Through a defined sales process and partnership with key sales leaders, Account Executives and Senior Account Executives will strive to meet and exceed quarterly and annual sales goals.

About The Role

Responsible for end-to-end sales cycle management, including sourcing, qualifying, negotiating, and closing deals.Articulate company services and benefits to potential clients through various communication channels. Develop a deep understanding of territory, competition, and market trends to execute a strategic territory plan.Create and implement sales strategies to increase revenue from existing customers and acquire new ones. Build influential relationships and generate sales leads through partner/channel networking, while effectively demonstrating Emburse SaaS solutions and leading sales opportunities.Range of $750K-$1M+ Yearly Quota

Must have

7+ years of experience selling financial SaaS solutions to companies with a minimum of 1500 employees New logo sales focus is required. Hunter not a farmer!Proven track record of closing six-figure ARR license dealsProven track record of consistently finishing above annual quotaStrong prospecting skillsAbility to set, manage and document agreed outcomes of successful meetingsKeen curiosity about businesses, how they work and specifically AP/Finance/Expense operationsStrong presentation skills

Nice to have

Preference for experience in selling to companies with 2500-5000+ employeesKnowledge of travel and expense and/or AP/Payments management industry highly preferredExperience selling to finance personasExperience with MEDDPICC, Challenger Sale

Emburse provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Emburse complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location where the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
